business_summary: This database supports an internal operations platform used in an industrial/plant environment to (1) assign and track operational tasks via checklists and one-off delegations, (2) record task completion/extension events with evidence (images/attachments) and delay metrics, (3) manage users, roles, and fine-grained access to modules/pages/departments, and (4) provide adjacent operational modules including store & purchase indents (requisitions), GRN bill approval workflow, repair gate-pass follow-ups, and visitor gate-pass tracking with approvals. The system is designed for multi-department usage with reminders, planned vs actual dates, and auditability of who assigned, executed, and verified work.

delegation.description: Operational delegation tasks (typically one-time assignments) given by a manager/supervisor to a person/department, with planning dates, submission/completion, reminders, attachment requirement, and computed delay.

foreign_keys.relationship: Delegation is categorized to an organizational department (text-based reference).
Delegation is assigned to a user by their display name (denormalized).
Delegation is created/assigned by a user/manager name (denormalized).

column_descriptions.task_id: Unique identifier of the delegation task.
column_descriptions.created_at: When the task record was created/assigned in the system.
column_descriptions.department: Department responsible for the task or to which the assignee belongs.
column_descriptions.name: Person responsible for executing the task (assignee display name).
column_descriptions.frequency: Recurrence type for the task; in observed data it's primarily one-time.
column_descriptions.remarks: Notes/remarks entered during or after execution (often completion notes).
column_descriptions.task_start_date: Scheduled start datetime for the task (often equals planned_date for one-time).
column_descriptions.given_by: Who assigned the task (manager/supervisor display name).
column_descriptions.image: URL/path to an image evidence or related file (if used).
column_descriptions.updated_at: Last update timestamp to the task record.
column_descriptions.planned_date: Planned/scheduled datetime for completion or occurrence.
column_descriptions.submission_date: When the assignee submitted/completed the task.
column_descriptions.color_code_for: Likely UI color coding bucket/flag (e.g., priority/overdue indicator).
column_descriptions.delay: Computed time difference between planned and submission (positive = late; negative = early).

delegation_done.description: Event/audit log of delegation task outcomes (completion or extension), including optional reasons, next extension date, and evidence URL. Acts like a history table for delegation updates.

foreign_keys.relationship: Links an outcome event to the underlying delegation task.
User who is associated with the task event (assignee), stored as text.
Manager/assigner associated with the task, stored as text.

column_descriptions.task_id: Delegation task identifier this event belongs to.
column_descriptions.created_at: Timestamp when the event (done/extend) was recorded.
column_descriptions.next_extend_date: If extended, the next planned date for completion/next review.
column_descriptions.reason: Reason for extension or completion notes.
column_descriptions.name: Assignee name captured at the time of the event.
column_descriptions.id: UUID primary key for the event record.

working_day_calender.description: Calendar dimension table for working dates, capturing weekday name (Hindi), week number, and month number. Used for reporting, scheduling, and KPI rollups by time.

column_descriptions.working_date: Calendar date used as the reporting/scheduling date grain.
column_descriptions.week_num: Week number (likely ISO-like or custom fiscal week index).
column_descriptions.id: Surrogate identifier for the calendar row.

checklist.description: Checklist task instances for recurring operational work (daily/weekly/monthly/etc.). Each row appears to represent a generated occurrence (planned_date) assigned to a user/department, with user submission status and admin verification.

foreign_keys.relationship: Checklist task is associated with a department (text-based reference).
Checklist task assignee (denormalized user name).
Checklist task creator/assigner (denormalized user name).

column_descriptions.task_id: Unique identifier for a checklist task occurrence/instance.
column_descriptions.department: Owning/responsible department for the checklist work.
column_descriptions.given_by: Person who created/assigned the checklist task.
column_descriptions.name: Person responsible for completing the checklist item (assignee).
column_descriptions.enable_reminder: Whether reminders should be sent for this checklist item.
column_descriptions.remark: User/admin notes; may capture completion remarks.
column_descriptions.status: General yes/no flag; likely indicates whether task is enabled/active or some completion toggle (values show yes/no).
column_descriptions.delay: Computed lateness/earliness interval relative to planned date/time.
column_descriptions.planned_date: Planned scheduled datetime for this occurrence (stored as text; often ISO string).
column_descriptions.created_at: When the task occurrence row was created/generated.
column_descriptions.task_start_date: Scheduled start datetime for the occurrence.
column_descriptions.submission_date: Datetime when user submitted/completed this checklist occurrence.

users.description: System users/employees with authentication fields, department affiliation, role (admin/user), status, leave windows, and extensive access-control configuration to modules/pages/departments/areas.

foreign_keys.relationship: User belongs to a department (text-based).
Indicates who created/onboarded the user (self-referential, text-based).

column_descriptions.created_at: When the user record was created.
column_descriptions.user_name: User display/login name (used widely as denormalized reference).
column_descriptions.password: Password credential (appears stored in plain text in samples; security risk).
column_descriptions.user_access: Department or access scope label(s) (often duplicates department).
column_descriptions.last_punch_time: Last attendance punch timestamp (integration with attendance device).
column_descriptions.page_access: Comma-separated UI page permissions (dashboard, all-task, delegation, etc.).
column_descriptions.system_access: Comma-separated modules/systems user can access (Checklist, Store & Purchase, HRMS, etc.).
column_descriptions.subscription_access_system: JSON-like string detailing subscription/document/payment systems and page permissions.
column_descriptions.user_access1: Comma-separated physical area/location access list (site/plant areas).
column_descriptions.store_access: Store module permissions (indent, PO, GRN approvals, etc.).
column_descriptions.verify_access_dept: Departments over which the user has verification authority (comma-separated list).

indent_approvals.description: Approval records for indents/requisitions, capturing approver, approval timestamp, remarks, and status. Supports multi-step approvals.

foreign_keys.relationship: Approval belongs to a specific indent line/record.
Approver user identifier; stored as varchar so may contain user id or name.

column_descriptions.id: Unique identifier for an approval record.
column_descriptions.approver_id: Approver identifier (intended to map to a user).

users_staging.description: Staging/import table for users (onboarding pipeline). Mirrors core user attributes before being promoted to the main users table.

foreign_keys.relationship: Staged user's department (text-based).

column_descriptions.id: Candidate user id (may match users.id when promoted).
column_descriptions.created_at: When the staged record was created/imported.
column_descriptions.password: Staged password (should be hashed in production).
column_descriptions.leave_date: Planned leave start (if captured during onboarding).

systems.description: Master list of application modules/systems and their base URLs. Used for navigation and entitlement mapping.

column_descriptions.systems: System/module name (e.g., HRMS, STORE AND PURCHASE).
column_descriptions.link: Base URL to launch the system.

repair_followup.description: Tracks repair gate-pass items issued to external parties/vendors and monitors follow-up stages with planned vs actual dates, delays, and status per stage until gate-pass closure.

foreign_keys.relationship: Department responsible for the repair follow-up.

column_descriptions.id: Unique record id for a repair follow-up line.
column_descriptions.gate_pass_date: Date the repair gate pass was issued.
column_descriptions.department: Department that issued/owns the repair follow-up.
column_descriptions.party_name: Vendor/party to whom item was sent for repair.
column_descriptions.actual1: Actual date for stage 1 milestone completion.
column_descriptions.time_delay1: Delay in days for stage 1 (planned vs actual).
column_descriptions.actual2: Actual date for stage 2 milestone completion.

departments.description: Reference/master data for organizational departments used across tasks, users, and operational workflows.

visitors.description: Visitor gate-pass register capturing visitor identity, visit purpose, person to meet, entry/exit times, approval workflow, and closure flag.

foreign_keys.relationship: Text-based reference to the person/host being visited.
Approver name (often an employee), stored as text.

column_descriptions.gate_pass_closed: Whether the gate pass is closed (true when OUT and finalized).

person_to_meet.description: Master list of hosts/employees who can be selected as the 'person to meet' in the visitor gate-pass module, including their phone number.

column_descriptions.id: Unique identifier for the host person record.
column_descriptions.created_at: When the host record was created.

indent.description: Detailed indent/requisition line records for store & purchase: what item is requested, by whom, for which department/division, quantities, planned vs actual processing timestamps, and approval status/approved quantity.

foreign_keys.relationship: Requesting department (text-based).

column_descriptions.id: Unique identifier for the indent line record.
column_descriptions.sample_timestamp: Timestamp when the line was captured/ingested (appears to be source timestamp).
column_descriptions.indent_series: Series code (e.g., I1/R1) used for numbering/workflow.
column_descriptions.requester_name: Name of the employee who raised the request.
column_descriptions.uom: Unit of measure for the requested item.
column_descriptions.cost_location: Cost center/location where expense should be booked.
column_descriptions.planned_1: Planned timestamp for first workflow milestone (e.g., approval/processing).
column_descriptions.request_status: Overall status of the request line (APPROVED/PENDING).
column_descriptions.created_at: Record creation timestamp in this system.

store_grn.description: Goods Receipt Note (GRN) bill tracking and approval workflow for vendor invoices: planned processing date, GRN metadata, bill amount, and boolean flags for sending/approvals/closure.

column_descriptions.planned_date: Planned datetime for processing/approval of the GRN bill.
column_descriptions.sended_bill: Whether bill has been sent/forwarded for approval.
column_descriptions.close_bill: Whether the bill/GRN is closed in workflow.

indent_requests.description: Header-level indent request table (one request per indent number) storing department, requester, priority, purpose, and overall status. Intended parent of indent_items and indent_approvals.

foreign_keys.relationship: Connects request header to detailed indent lines by indent number (logical; not enforced).
Requesting department (text-based).

column_descriptions.id: Unique identifier for the indent request header.

indent_items.description: Line items for an indent request header: requested item name, quantities, and optional available stock snapshot.

foreign_keys.relationship: Items belong to an indent request header.

column_descriptions.id: Unique identifier for the indent item line.
column_descriptions.available_stock: Available stock at time of request (snapshot for decision-making).

suggested_semantic_schema:
DOMAIN OVERVIEW
- This database powers an internal operations platform with modules:
  1) Checklist tasks (recurring tasks) and Delegation tasks (one-off assignments)
  2) Task completion/extension history (delegation_done)
  3) User management and access control (users, users_staging)
  4) Store & Purchase indents / approvals (indent, indent_requests, indent_items, indent_approvals)
  5) GRN bill approval workflow (store_grn)
  6) Repair gate-pass follow-up tracking (repair_followup)
  7) Visitor gate-pass and approvals (visitors, person_to_meet)
  8) Reference data: departments, systems, working_day_calender

ENTITY NOTES (HOW TO QUERY)
- Users are identified by users.id, but many operational tables store user_name text in columns like name / given_by / approved_by. Joins may require matching on users.user_name (string join), not users.id.
- Departments are stored as free text in many tables; optionally map to departments.department.

TASKS: CHECKLIST VS DELEGATION
- checklist: recurring operational task occurrences.
  - Key fields: task_id, department, name (assignee), given_by (assigner), frequency, planned_date (TEXT), task_start_date, submission_date, user_status_checklist, admin_done, delay.
  - Interpretation:
    - user_status_checklist indicates user completion (Pending/Yes/No).
    - admin_done indicates administrative verification.
    - delay is lateness vs planned.
- delegation: one-off delegated tasks.
  - Key fields: task_id, department, name, given_by, planned_date, task_start_date, submission_date, status, delay.
  - delegation_done is the event log for delegation status changes.

DELEGATION HISTORY
- delegation_done: multiple rows per delegation.task_id; newest created_at is latest event.
  - status in delegation_done can be done/completed/extend.
  - next_extend_date used when status='extend'.

TIME DIMENSION
- working_day_calender can be used to roll up by working_date, week_num, month.
  - Many task tables use TIMESTAMP while checklist.planned_date is TEXT; cast as timestamp when needed.

STORE & PURCHASE (INDENTS)
- indent: appears to hold detailed line-level indent records including item_code/product_name/qty and request_status.
- indent_requests + indent_items: a more normalized header/line model (may be unused currently; sample empty).
- indent_approvals: approvals per indent_id (likely maps to indent.id or indent_requests.id depending on implementation; use indent_id semantics carefully).

GRN WORKFLOW
- store_grn: GRN/bill tracking.
  - approval flags: sended_bill, approved_by_admin, approved_by_gm, close_bill.

VISITOR GATE PASS
- visitors: one row per visit.
  - status: IN/OUT; approval_status: pending/approved; gate_pass_closed boolean.
  - person_to_meet is a text name; can be mapped to person_to_meet.person_to_meet.

SYSTEMS NAVIGATION
- systems: list of modules and links; users.system_access lists module entitlements as comma-separated text.

COMMON ANALYTICS QUESTIONS (SUPPORTED)
- Overdue tasks: filter checklist/delegation where submission_date is null and planned_date/task_start_date < now().
- Delay reporting: use delay interval; for checklist you may need to compute delay if null using submission_date - task_start_date.
- Completion rates by department/user: group by department, name with status fields (delegation.status; checklist.user_status_checklist/admin_done).
- Approval throughput: indent.request_status and store_grn approval flags over time.

DATA QUALITY / NORMALIZATION CAVEATS
- status and categorical fields vary by case (Done vs done; Yes vs yes). Normalize using LOWER() for comparisons.
- checklist.planned_date is TEXT; cast to timestamp for date logic.
- Many references are denormalized strings (names/departments). Prefer robust joins (case-insensitive) or maintain mapping tables if possible.
